Former Gov: Terry McAuliffe's claim of inheriting a $2.4 billion debt left over by Republicans has been consistently made in various speeches and interviews.
The claim was fact: checked in 2015, questioning how McAuliffe could have inherited a deficit when the state constitution requires a balanced budget.
It was found that when McAuliffe took of: his predecessor, Republican Gov. Bob McDonnell, had left two balanced budget bills on his desk.
However: McAuliffe's communication chief explained that the economy slowed during the winter and spring of 2014, causing tax revenues to fall below expectations, and the previous administration had supported a spending threshold that was too high.
